Election for Majlis (Maldivian People's Council)
description:
Sourced from predicthq.com - At Stake in this Election:

All 87 seats in the Maldivian People’s Council

Government Structure: 

Chief of State: President Mohamed MUIZZI (since 17 November 2023)
Head of Government: President Mohamed MUIZZI (since 17 November 2023)
Assembly: unicameral People's Council (ރައްޔިތުންގެ މަޖިލިސް / Rayyithunge Majlis) with 87 seats

Electoral System: 

The President is elected by absolute majority vote through a two-round system and may serve up to two 5-year terms.
In the People's Council, 87 members are elected by plurality vote in single-member constituencies to serve 5-year terms. There are no term limits.

Last Election:
In the 2019 legislative election, the Maldivian Democratic Party (MDP) won a majority in the People’s Council with 65 seats. Three additional parties and seven independents also won seats. Voter turnout was 81.32%.
Information for Voters:
The 2024 Parliamentary Elections – Material /  ރައްޔިތުންގެ މަޖިލީހުގެ އިންތިޚާބު 2024 މެޓީރިއަލް (In Dhivehi)
New/Unique in this Election: 
The election date was rescheduled from 17 March to 21 April 2024 to avoid coinciding with Ramadan.
Key Deadlines:

Candidate filing deadline: 14 February 2024
Voter registration deadline: N/A, voter registration is passive

Main Parties in this Election:

Maldivian Democratic Party (MDP) 

Seats won in last election: 65 out of 87


Progressive Party of Maldives (PPM) 

Seats won in last election: 8 out of 87 (in coalition with the PNC)


People’s National Congress (PNC) 

Seats won in last election: 8 out of 87 (in coalition with the PPM)


Jumhuri Party (JP) 

Seats won in last election: 5 out of 87


Maldives Development Alliance (MDA)

Seats won in last election: 2 out of 87 


Adhaalath Party (AP) 

Seats won in last election: 0 out of 87


The Democrats 

Seats won in last election: 0 out of 87


Maldives Reform Movement (MRM) 

Seats won in last election: 0 out of 87


Maldives National Party (MNP) 

Seats won in last election: 0 out of 87


Maldives Thirdway Democrats (MTD) 

Seats won in last election: 0 out of 87



Population and Registered Voters:

Population: 523,790 (2022)
Registered Voters: 284,887 (2024)

Gender Data:

Female Population: 222,470 (2022)
CEDAW Status: Ratified (by accession) 1 July 1993
Gender Quota:  No
Female Candidates in this election: Yes
Number of Female Legislators (pre-election): 4 out of 80 (5%) in the People’s Majlis
Human Development Index (HDI) Position: 0.762, High, Rank 87 (2022)
Social Institutions and Gender Index (SIGI) Categorization: Not available 

Disability Data:

CRPD Status: Signed 2 October 2007, Ratified 5 April 2010 
Projected population with a disability: 83,806 (2022 est.)

IFES Resources:

Does IFES have a presence in the Maldives: Yes, office
Election Snapshot: Yes
Election Access: Yes
Election Judgements: Yes, 1 judgement and 3 resources
